Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the silken concordia last week and highly recommend it, the hotel was very clean, and the staff very helpful. The cake shop next door was a bonus :)

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: eherm
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had a reservation here in July '11. When my friend went to check in, they were overbooked and moved us to another hotel. I think it may have been the Hotel Parallel down the street. Either way, wherever they sent us was not far away and perfectly fine and lived up to all our expectations (although the area could have been better but it was near a metro station). In sum, we ended up with a room at least as nice as we booked, just not at the Silken Concordia.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: gkgemmell65
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at silken concordia, and was really impressed with it. The hotel is situated 300yards from poble sec metro stop on green line 3, which is handy if you are visiting for a match, as the nou camp is also on line 3 , and only 5 stops away on metro. Also the area where the hotel is situated is ideal for walking to las ramblas and to the port and beach, its only about 15 to 20 min walk to both. Oliver on reception is also most helpful with anything you need to know with regards to tours , areas to visit bars etc. This is my seventh time i have visited barcelona in recent years , and this hotel i would return to again due to its location , cost, and helpfullness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room with modern look”
Reviews.Author: audrey151
Reviews.Content: the double-room looked great, and was decently-sized as well. the toilet was also big and airy with a bathtub. a pity that the reception staff didn't seem too keen/capable of helping us. on the first night our AC wasn't working, but a phone to the desk got us the response that the guy couldn't help us as he couldn't leave the desk. the next morning, a trip down to inquire about the issue got us the response that the AC doesn't work during winter, and that we had to open the window if it got too warm. strangely enough, that night the AC decided to blow out cold air, unlike the hot air it constantly emitted the night before (mind you, we had the settings in the right mode). breakfast costs a rather hefty 9.50 euros, but the selection is decent, with a wide array of breads and pastries, cold cuts and cured meats, as well as hot dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable prie at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: angellove2002ph
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast, nice location, clean rooms, good wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Decent size rooms, hard beds, so so staff, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: genjisan
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to Barcelona. Last time we stayed on the same avenue so I should have known better. It's not the best part of town but overall is fine. The staff can be friendlier but I think that's the Spanish culture. We had a problem operating our safe and I think it took like an hour for someone to come help us. The instructions were soo wrong so if you're going to use the safe, you'll probably be asking for help too. There are a lot of small eateries around the hotel so you won't have a problem there. The metro is SUPER convenient being right across the street so you can get pretty much anywhere. The only thing is that the subways stop at midnight which sucks for such a party town. After hours, they have something called a Nitebus. I didn't get a chance to try it but it seems convenient. The hotel is close to Las Ramblas which is nice. Our room was decent. We had a fridge too which is nice to put bottled waters. We had 2 twin beds (double) which was nice since I was traveling with a friend. The beds were WAY too hard for me though. I even tried padding it with 2 of the thermal blankets but still too hard. We had a HUGE bathroom which was awesome! There were some weird smells though throughout the hotel. Nothing bad but more like concentrated Glade air fresheners (I'm not the biggest fan). We had breakfast included in our package and it was YUMMY! They had an assortment of croissants, toast, pastry, yogurt, cereal, sausage, tea, coffee, OJ, some other juices and my favorite was the eggs and this frittata with potatoes.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: vacati0nnati0n
Reviews.Content: We paid far less for this 3 star restaurant then the ME barcelona which was a 5 star. It was no ordinary 3 star! Great location west of Las Rumblas. Tons of affordable restaurants and cafes. There is a cafe/restaurant in the lobby with reasonable rates and plenty of choices along diagonal avenue. The locatioon is tricky, it is located on Diagonal Avenue, the location on the website is the spanish version(differs from maps). Rooms were clean, staff friendly. The only complaint was the maids who entered our room twice without knocking/warning between 8:40am and 9:40am. No view from the room but the rooms were comfortable and modern. We liked it alot. Close to the Poble Sec station four blocks south from the Spanish Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but some disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rileymax56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Silken Concordia for 8 nights in Summer 2011. The location of this hotel may be its greatest asset. It is directly across from a tube stop, and within easy walking distance of The Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya and Arenas de Barcelona to the west, and Barceloneta to the east. A vast array of restaurants, a supermarket, and other services are all nearby. The decor of the hotel is somewhat spartan, but the overall ambiance is one of quiet and calm, which can be a good thing after a day pounding the pavement, shopping, and sightseeing. My room was on the second floor, down a quiet hallway. Sadly, the only window (small at that) faced a triangular air shaft, so artificial light was a necessity even at the brightest part of the day. One lamp near the desk was burned out and repeated requests for a new light bulb went unheeded. The bed seemed reasonable at first, but as the days/nights went by, it seemed to be little more than a very hard surface with no "give." On the other hand, the bathroom was spacious, and the amenity box (soap, sponge, shampoo, conditioner, comb, shoe horn, shower cap, sewing kit, and lotion) was topped up each day. Room service was prompt, and in my case (early riser), my room was always refreshed soon after I would leave for a morning walk. As I do not speak Catalan, I had hoped for a selection of TV stations that might broadcast in English. There were only two channels -- a sort-of news program (which seemed to be on a "loop") and National Geographic. The latter channel aired but two programs repeatedly all week! I did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but the expansive morning breakfast buffet seemed to be a popular choice for many hotel guests. Front desk attendants were all polite and friendly. Would I recommend this hotel? I suppose I might, but only to folks who were planning a stopover or 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “We never will stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: virjus
Reviews.Content: Hotel it self - good, but area were terrible ( dirty, smell trrible from konteiners). One thing good - metro station near.

Reviews.Title: “Over-advertised corner-cutting”
Reviews.Author: civertson
Reviews.Content: Upon first arriving at this hotel we were greeted with a subtly patronising tone when the hotel clerk realised we were two men wanting to share a bed, offering to "correct the mistake" by giving us a twin room instead. An initial inspection of the room gave an ok feeling, but looking closer we found some of the toiletries just being empty boxes (an uncommonly provided dental kit that we didn't want anyway, but still), the minibar fridge didn't actually keep anything we put into it cool, and the hotel internet being next to impossible to get onto. Breakfast is simply not worth it here if it hasn't been included in the price of your room, a pack of croissants and a bottle of orange juice for a quarter of the price from any supermarket would be a wiser choice. A final negative point, perhaps the worst – some unexpected visitors in the form of a few silverfish crawling over the bathroom floor. On the other hand, AC worked great (perhaps a little too well if you go to bed without thinking about what you set the dial to), and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a nice room!”
Reviews.Author: Cre3pyTie
Reviews.Content: One of the best features of this hotel is the location: in front of a metro station (line 3) which will take you to virtually everywhere you will want to go in Barcelona. It is also in walkable distance from Plaça de Espanya and its great Arena mall. From the Parellel station (1 station away) you can get the funicular wih will take you to the Montjuic park. The hotel room is basic, but well suitable for a 3 star.Bathroom is ok with great amenities that were replaced every day (like shower gel, shampoo, shaving kit, etc). Too bad sometimes there would be a strange smell coming form it (and from the hall). I was lucky enough to get a back room (not facing Parallel avenue) so it was very quiet at night. Can´t review the restaurant but I can suggest the Basilico restaurant (a few steps on the other side of the street) which offers a "meal of the day" with a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “the traffic is heavy outside so you won't hear the fan from next door!”
Reviews.Author: fearanti
Reviews.Content: the front of the property faces onto avenida parallel, which is a main thoroughfare with all the noise you'd expect. when the room next to you uses the bathroom the ventilation is like a big vaccum cleaner going...but you might be lucky: if the traffic is heavy you may not hear it :-) The people are pretty unhelpful. the rooms are basic. in terms of proximity to things, it's a pretty compact town so it's not too far to the Ramblas etc. there's also a tube across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and really comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: MariaDesiree
Reviews.Content: If you don't want your stay in Bacelona to be just focused on "La Rambla", the Silken Concordia Hotel is a good option. Just about a quarter of an hours walk to the harbour-area and with lots of smaller authentic diningplaces in the area around (try f.x. walking down the Carrer de Vilá i Vilá). Also the hotel is situated closely to both the Parc Monjuric and Parc Miró. The rooms are clean, well kept and with modern equipment and the staff is always polite and friendly. The view from the room is nothing more to talk about but we were positively surpriced how little the sound from the mainroad could be heard. If you're in a hurry and don't have the time to look for a place to eat breakfast we'll recommend having breakfast at the hotel - we tried it for two days and it has everything needed. Though if you have the time try walking to the harbour area - we had f.x. great breakfast with fresh squeezed orange juice and iced coffée at the "Buenas Migas" - just opposite the big Cinema. The best thing about the hotel (or the room) are the really, really comfortable beds. When you're been walking in Barcelona for a whole day this is really something to "come home to":-)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Break!”
Reviews.Author: Homerandmarge2
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was splendid from the first minute. It was the first time me and my girlfriend had been away together and it couldn't of been at a better place. We arrived at the hotel at 12pm and check in was not until 3pm, however they allowed us to check in early which was a great help, with the room ready and waiting for us. The location was great, a short walking distance to the heart of Barcelona. We attended a number of attractions, finding that they were all within walking distance, with no need to use the Metro during our stay, which is also easily accessable from the Hotel. I'd particularly recommend the Barcelona zoo, a 20 minute walk away from the hotel with the sandy beach being even closer. We did not choose to eat in the Hotel, so cannot commend on the food, however, the reception staff were extremely helpful. We had to ask for a number of things during our time at Silken Concordia, such as bottel openers, for wine which we had brought from the local shops, and sissors to cut up some plasters - all of which the staff had handy for us in seconds! They spoke good english and were very polite, a credit to the hotel. Our room was clean, with a huge bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great little vacation”
Reviews.Author: Yezza
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel was nice - room clean, quiet and comfortable, location very good with bus and metro station right in front of the hotel, not far from the airport too, staff very friendly and helpfull, as much we needed help on a short city break. Price was also great. Around the hotel a lot of stores and small restaurants, specially great pastry in Dino pan :). We enjoyed all 5 days and, also, slept very well - and baby too in very cute cot. Very good heating too.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, paper thin walls, bad smell in the room, carpet needs changing”
Reviews.Author: mavac70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a last resort, no much else available the week I was in Barcelona. The room was overpriced. Staff at reception didn't speak English but was helpful although suggested a local restaurant that turned out to be a rbig ip-off (l'albezar). Many problems with the room, a bad rotten smell developed when the air-con was off n I was forced to keep it on at night too. some renovation was ongoing n during the day it was noisy, if one happened to be in the room. Between midnight n 2am a lot of noise due to people returning n having v little care n respect of others. Doors slammed other banging that made it impossible to sleep until rather late. I was there for 6 nights n in the end I was exhausted. no coffee /tea facilities in the room. The breakfast buffet was poor n for sure not worth it the 9.50€ I was charged. The room was clean bt in definite need of re-decor starting from the carpet n moving on to the bathroom. the bath curtain had yellowed along the bottom. when I showered despite my many attempts water spread on the floor around the bath. The worst for me it was the non-stop noise between midnight n 2 am. I'd not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and simple”
Reviews.Author: Shawn215
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in Barcelona. It was off Las Ramblas, but it only took a few minutes to get there, plus seeing the different tpes of neighborhoods on our way to the tourist section was nice. The hotel itself was pretty simple. The room was clean and the safe in the room was nice to have. The front desk employees were more than helpful, and their English was great. We wouldn't have found out about Sitges if it wasn't for them. Don't go to the beaches in Barcelona, take the train to Sitges.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel breakfast not included”
Reviews.Author: Donnellap
Reviews.Content: nice hotel - good service, missed breakfast a few times but not included in price drinks are cheap - good location, good security.internet free but no good connection on 2 floor only in reception area - reception very helpful

Reviews.Title: “The reliable”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRothenberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for its purpose, nothing real fancy.. but clean, comfortable rooms. I wish it had been a little closer to stuff. I was happy with the price and happy with what I got for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wazza08
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Great location in Poble Sec directly across the street from a metro stop. Lots of nice little bakeries and cages nearby. Rooms were clean and tidy. The only downside was that the bed matresses were pretty hard. Overall I thought it was good value for money and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location & rooms perfect”
Reviews.Author: MScoyne
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at around 11.30am and our room was ready for us which was very helpful. The staff had good english and were very helpful. The hotel is right by the Pobel Sec metro station, this is so handy and you dont here a thing. The hotel is only about a 8 to 10 min walk to La Rambala and also about 10min walk to the Marina, so location is very good, about €5 to €7 for a taxi back from La Ramabla. The room was very clean, warm and finished with an uptodate style. The bathroom had a bath with sower and all the normall shower gels and accesories. The room also come with a safe which is alsways great in a hotel away. You couldnt have asked for any more of the staff and even on the day we left, we coiuld leave our bags with them and they even gave us a ticket for them, so we felt very secure with them being left there. I would recommend the hotel to any one, great location, freindly staff and clean rooms, and feels a least a 3 star, maybe more.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel - served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: jesann
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the Avinguda del Paral-lel very close to the Poble Sec metro station. The hotel was clean and functional - the bathroom was nice but the floor flooded when you used the shower and the beds were very hard. Our room was in the back of the hotel so next to no road noise but zero outlook from the window. The room was also first in the corridor on level two so next to an echo'y stair well which spiralled around lift shaft. It was quite noisy from early morning with people traffic. The breakfast was ok but definitely stick to continental and avoid the English breakfast elements. Desk staff were very nice and helpful and bags were left safely on the last day. Location is not great and the area is a little rough but not particularly threatening. Excellent metro service from Poble Sec and a number 46 bus runs to and from the Airport stopping just up the street at Placa Espanya. We used the T10 ticket which gives you 10 zone 1 x 1hour 15 min rides for around 8 euros - the ticket can be shared if you want to - lots of good info on Barcelona Tourism. site.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, expensive breakfast/food”
Reviews.Author: indianUKdoctor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were decent size and clean.B'fast and food was very expensive so preferred to eat outside. The most disappointing point about this hotel is internet service in waiting area. As I didn't carry my own laptop, I had to use their service. They just have one PC which dead slow, inetrnet is slower than dial up & costs u £2 per 20 mins which is an absolute rip off! Location wise it's bang opposite to Metro station and very close to city centre. Overall, I would avoid going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “welcoming,cenTRAL BUT NOT TOO CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: agatwo
Reviews.Content: WE DISCOVERED BARCELONA IN THE MID NINETIES, and have returned seven times since, the last two times we have stayed at the Silken Concordia, on both occasions we have been struck by the friendliness of the staff not only on recption but in the resturant and the cleaning staff upstairs. The rooms are more than adequate size wise and comfortable. The hotel is situated on parallell, ten to fifteen minutes gentle stroll from the port and the same from the rambalas, five minutes in the other direction brings you to plac de Espanya and the Magic Fountains one of Barcas big tourist attractions. all in all agreat place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Cheap. Splendid Experience”
Reviews.Author: mwc88
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stopped at Hotel Silken Concordia. I was a tad nervous at first as we booked it because it was cheap but really didn't expect anything decent. The main lobby is clean and has access to the internet. The hotel room was spacious, with a big plasma tv and great air-con which actually works great. Only downside to the hotel is the walk to the la ramblas as it seems to be a dodgy area, but only when night falls. There are several cheap bars and restaurants on the Avg. Parallel where the hotel is situated. For the money we paid, we couldn't fault it as the beds were comfy and the air-con went down a treat after experiencing roasting temperatures in Barcelona. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: monarlo
Reviews.Content: PROS Very friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable, clean and spacious room. In (20-30min) walking distance of the beach and the Old Town, and right opposite Metro station. Very good value for money. Free internet. CONS Rather lacking in character or atmosphere - both the hotel and the neighbourhood it's in. SUMMARY I was really pleased with this hotel for two night at a very reasonable rate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain !”
Reviews.Author: Candyfloss88
Reviews.Content: I was there in May, spend 4 nights there. The reception staffs are friendly and helpful and speaks good English. Room and bathroom are quite clean. Location is not bad either as there are a metro station just accross from the hotel . Food in the restaurant is ok, it would be better if there are more selections of food to choose. Overall I'm satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, in good location”
Reviews.Author: AlanUK45
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights prior to joining a cruise ship. The staff were helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. Our room was on the second floor at the front but we were not disturbed by traffic noise. The breakfast buffet had a good selection. We had dinner the first evening which was fine except the restaurant lacked atmosphere. Probably a better option is the short walk into the old town and spend the same amount in a more traditional restaurant. The metro station is right outside the hotel for easy transport. A minor disappointment was no English speaking stations on the TV to catch up on news.

Reviews.Title: “good location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: minnie219
Reviews.Content: The big advantage of this hotel is its accessibility.The metro station is right across the street. just one or few stops by the metro,you will be in the main area aldy.when i searched the hotel to stay in Barcelona,I'v found so many ppl complaining about the noise issue for any hotel located in the city center. for my 4 nights staying in this hotel,I had quiet sleep every night. Besides,their room is very spacious,clean.I found the staff kinda friendly and helpful.They speak good enough english to help me out. I booked the hotel through "www.booking.com".It's stated that wireless internet is free in public area but charged EUR6 per hour.when I checked at the receptionist about using their charged wireless service, she kindly enough told me that I could use the cable internet service with no charge. I am so thankful from saving up some money. I would def choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Karen90
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd hotel we have stayed in while in Barcelona and one we wouldnt use again. Our welcome was functional with the receptionist barely speaking. We werent offered maps of the city or told when breakfast was served. We had a sleepless night the first night of our stay as the window didnt close properly and the noise outside rumbled on all through the night. Also we had no hot water the following morning. We complained to the receptionist and got moved to a different room which was a great improvement but outside noise could still be heard. Breakfast was quite good, although the 'hot' selection is only hot if it has only just been put out, as it is just put on the side without a warmer underneath. It is in a good location, central with a metro stop just outside. We have stayed in a hotel down the street previously and if we want to stay in the same area again would use the other hotel (Barcelona Universal)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: medf88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for about £40/night room only basis. It is only 5seconds away from Poble Sec metro (Parlament exit) which was very handy! It takes about 15/20mins to walk from Las Ramblas and it was safe to do so, even at 2am. There are many cafes/restuarants/supermarkets near the hotel, which was useful for us to stock up on water and snacks! The location of this hotel is good because it isn't too far from the touristy parts but far enough to see a more 'local' part of Barcelona. The room itself was clean. There were a few stains on the carpet in the hallway (due to bleach?) The air condition was quite useless since it was boiling hot when we returned each night to our room so we kept the window open.Our room faced the front of the hotel and so being on a main road, there is some considerable amount of noise.However, with the window closed, it was quite quiet. It didnt bother us since we were always tired from the day we had! The hotel felt quite secure, there is a safe to leave your valuables! If you are looking for a clean and decent room to sleep and relax then this is a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean, Modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: johnriggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November 09 paying approximately £60 per night on a room only basis. Arrived late at night and received a warm welcome from the receptionist and night porter. The room and en-suite bathroom were clean, modern and of a reasonable size. The hotel is about a 10 - 15 minute walk from Playa Catalunya and Las Ramblas area. Very convenient for access to the Poble Sec metro station. I would recomment this hotel as a reasonably priced base for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good quality”
Reviews.Author: GaborLondon
Reviews.Content: I had spent 2 nights in this hotel In 2009, november. The room was warm and spotless, bathroom impeccable. Unfortunately my window faced to the backside. The staff was very polite and helpful, with good spoken english. I was pretty much satisfied with this hotel. Off: I have read a comment, in which the hotel was considered as a bit off the tourist routes, but my point of view is opposite. Many amenities are nearby, and only 10-25 mins walk away the Montjuic area, seaside, La Rambla, Plaza Espanya. I warmly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan
Reviews.Content: Across the street from a Metro stop, 10 minute walk to Plaza Espanya for train to Montserrat and all major metro connections . 10 minute walk to cross-town bus to Parc Guell. If you are planning on really exploring Barcelona, this is a great location for access to transportation. Neighborhood is very basic (not fancy), but there was a self-service laundry around the corner (although about 15 euros for 2 loads; still cheaper than the hotel); lots of small restaurants; markets and bread shops, etc. Hotel not maintained as well as it could be; stain on the carpet in the bedroom, walls slightly scuffed; shower curtains instead of glass; problems with our toilet twice. Without those minor things, it could be a 4-star. They let us check in very early on our arrival and stay late when we departed. Staff not large, but helpful. We got excellent recommendations on transportation (especially the bus to Parc Guell, which is across town and not convenient to Metro stations). Also charged for the internet , but we found an internet cafe a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hugobarbosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good located (Av Parallel) with the underground across the street. The staff was polite and try to resolve every problems (in ower case the was none). Large rooms and very clean. It is in a busy avenue but it is quiet and you have a good and relaxing sleep. The only thing i didn't like was the fact that if you choose to have the breakfast at the hotel ther's 2 choises. If you choose "Express Breakfast" it's cheaper but you have to carry you breakfast to a small room in the first floor. Not the room because was clean but the fact that you have to carry you things (but for the price it was a good value too). I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Help and Room”
Reviews.Author: Toro_and_the_Matador
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very helpful and spoke English which was helpful when my ATM card didn't work because I hadn't notified them that I was traveling to Europe. The hotel had internet connection which help me to find the phone number to call for problems with the card in Europe. The hotel rooms were large, modern, clean and comfortable. The location was decent and the price was good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed!excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kaymccon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you need for a short barcelona get away. we got a good deal,a comfort room for 216 euros for 3 nights.the rooms were spotless,everything you need. we never had a problem with the air con. breakfast is good,bit strange for my liking though.all sorts of meats and pastries.the location of the hotel is great.its in a quieter area with a metro (poble sec)just outside so you can get everywhere.i would like to warn of one restaurant on La Rambla to avoid- La Poma, meant to be an american style. its so overpriced and the food is horrible. we ordered hamburgers(which came without a bun)they were dripping with grease. and an orange juice was 5 euros!!!!on the up side Pita House on the rambla was very nice

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: lavalamp8786
Reviews.Content: Very good choice! It was a good deal, probably because it was Feb and so it was off peak season but it was a steal! with ryanair flights for £12return, we spent around £50 each for a 3D 2N getaway on flights and accomodation. BARGAIN! and a good tip is instead of eating on the ramblas, go down the alleys that lead off the main stretch, tapas is much more local, cheaper , better quality and wider choice. it can look like a dodgy area, but it is so worth it to not be taken advantage of just because were tourists! also go all the way inside la bouqeria (a market on ramblas) towards the back are cheap local tapas bars and it was amazing! hotel is lovely, toiletries, coffee/tea, power shower, modern, quiet. Service was not the best because it is quite a small hotel so usually only one or two staff behind the desk. they were so helpful to telling us where to go and how to get there. But when the free internet was down, it was fixed within hours! we were very impressed with the quality of the hotel for the price we paid! location could be better, but with the metro literally across the street, it was more than easy to take it to gaudi's park, casa mila, the saggradda familia cathedral and lots of other places. its about 20 mins walk to ramblas and the port. the area was not crawling with tourists like in the ramblas which was perfect for us and there were plenty of little cafes and supermarkets along the avenue anyway. overall, highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “good but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: leabaela
Reviews.Content: i had a nice solo stay at this hotel. well located. the subway is just across the street and 15 minute walk to go to the Rambla. Really clean and safe Good Air Con without noise Just have to confess that its a tiny bit expensive but really good value.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: bb81_8
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this hotel. I nearly got killed when the lift door closed on me. I reported it to the manager and he didnt want to know at all about it. He said the lifts are broke and they dont work poperly, but they were still in use. The sheets on the bed were never changed the 4 nights we were there. There was cockroaches in the batroom and a constant smell . It was a shocking hotel to stay in. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillyPickett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a one night pre-cruise. Room size was large and bed comfortable. Free wifi did not require a password just worked. Room was hot due to inefficient air conditioning which disengages when you leave the room (need to put room key in slot on wall). Windows did open but small terrace was littered with many cigarette butts. It was quite a long walk from the airporter bus stop. Stay was adequate but not remarkable. Safe in room was left locked so needed to have technician come and open. It was handled quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: kbeck36369
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of the hotel, I was a bit worried about the hotel after already booking it through Expedia. But it was a really nice hotel in a great location. We only stayed at the Silken Concordia for the night, as we were about to take a cruise the next day out of Barcelona. The hotel is located right across the street from a Metro stop, three stops away from Drassanes where we were to get off for the port area so it was ideal for us. The only problem we found with carting our luggage was more with the Metro system (lots of steps and no escalators or elevators), but that was found to be the case all over the city. Only one minor problem with the hotel which wasn't a big deal was that we were traveling in a family with separate rooms. They put us on different floors and when we asked if we could be put together, they acted as though they didn't want to be bothered. There is free Wifi in the rooms, just need to ask for access at the front desk. They will then give you an access code. Rooms were rather spacious for Europe and well decorated. Good place to stay for a night or two while in Barcelona and for a good price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but nothing to really rave about”
Reviews.Author: rene_555
Reviews.Content: went on a trip across three major spanish cities and this was the hotel choice for barcelona. this cost more than the other hotels we stayed in, was of less star rating and was for a shorter period of time. i know its peak season, but deffinatly not worth the 160 odd pound it was for 2 nights when there is probably a lot more around for the same price. really, really good location (hence choice) good metro links. only one line runs to the tube station by the hotel, but it contains all the major tourist stops at any rate. room is okay. nicely decorated. we had a double. of adequate size, but not the biggest i have seen. probably becasue the bed wasn't a double more of a king, which was nice. bathroom looks nice, but i wasn't overally happy with it. the shower curtain doesn't keep all the water in the tub. the toilet has a problem with it. when flushed it just kept filling until you went back to press the flush again shortly and sharply. the first time we realised this, the sisten in the toilet had been filling for 2 hours! the toiletry freebies are yucky at this hotel, haha. so if you usually rely on hotel provisions, i wouldn't at this one! didn't eat in the resturant as wasn't much choice for vegetarians. overall, an okay stay. clean n tidy. wouldn't stay there for the same cost again though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlhdib
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for the price and location. Beautiful rooms, excellent service and staff, would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Free internet in the rooms, had a wonderful time. Wuld definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “No air condition and rooms are boiling!!!”
Reviews.Author: Minimini1
Reviews.Content: the hotel it self was a normal Spanish hotel with normal facilities but to our big surprice the hotel informed that they don't have air condition even if they advertise it online. the whole hotel was set to one temperature with no possibility to adjust your room temperature which was about 40 c hot. it was impossible to sleep, work, or do anything else in the room without having the windows open all the time and even then it was boiling hot. having the window open at night made it impossible to sleep because of the constant street noise that doesn't stop in Barcelona. at least for us who came to Barcelona to work at a trade fair it was a big deal since we all went to work and important meetings completely tired after no sleep. we asked many times from reception but were told that the hotel doesn't have air con.....this cant be true. it is just simply too expensive to turn it on i assume? if this is the case the customers should be informed about this in advance.... cannot recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: carrotop17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend. I must say after reading some of the reviews i was a little worried as i had booked it as a xmas present. I was pleasantly suprised at how clean the reception was, also the room we stayed in and the hallways. Not an inch of dust in sight. Our room was tidied everyday, we had clean towels as often as we needed them and there was enough toiletries supplied on the first day to see us right through to the last day. The only thing did not work properly was the air conditioning, but that was easily solved with having the window open. Yes it was quite noisey outside but if you did the amout of walking and sightseeing that we managed to do, then like me you would fall asleep as soon as your head touched the pillow! We didn't eat in the hotel at all but that was purely through choice because we couldn't be bothered getting out of bed for it and we were out till late at night. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good standard, thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: patatas
Reviews.Content: Over all good hotel, convenient location, nice staff, clean and adequate room. Only problem was thin walls, we heard everything the neighbours said, and unfourtunately we had noisy neighbours one night.

Reviews.Title: “The Dirtiest Hotel Room I Have Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: Poots-UK
Reviews.Content: I can't believe my fellow reviewers stayed at the same hotel! This hotel is promoting itself as a boutique hotel with extra services like massage and gourmet menus, but it cannot even get the basics right. It is certainly no better than an average 3* hotel. On arrival we were shown to a room that had clearly not been cleaned properly in a LONG time. There were brown stains all over the walls, at both sides and the foot of the bed, a thick layer of dust on the bedhead and bedside lights and the room had not been hoovered. The bedspread was also stained. We advised the receptionist of the damage to the walls and brought him to the room to show him the problem as we wanted to be sure we wouldn't be charged for any damage. I was unwell and couldn't be bothered with the hassle of changing room, but we asked that the walls be washed and the room hoovered the next day. The room was neither hoovered properly not dusted and the walls were not cleaned during our entire 4 night stay. The bed was made and the bathroom tidied, but the layer of dust on the glass desk got thicker each day. In the communal hallways there was a thick layer of dust along the edge of the carpets, so it was clearly not just that we got a shabby room. It is a shame as we liked some aspects of the hotel. The location is fantastic, easily accessible by bus from the airport, and right next to the subway and bus stop to the main sites. The toiletries were nice (although they were never replenished after the first day). Based on the terrible standard of cleanliness I wouldn't recommend the Silken Concordia. However, if they sorted out their cleaners it would be a nice 3* hotel in a perfect location. I hope the management read this review...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for walkers”
Reviews.Author: Grumpygramps
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, Monday to Friday, hotel was clean and quiet, staff very helpful and always with a smile. Hotel situated within walking distance to most of the attractions ( all four of us in our sixties and had no trouble walking) 20 minutes to the Ramblas or the port and 10 minutes to the Metro where you can get on the cable car to the castle ( great views of the city from there). Food at the hotel was a suprise the daily menu is eight courses including wine and bottled water for 17 euros. There are many eating places around the hotel, try the basilico restaurant across the road from the hotel but you may need to book

Reviews.Title: “a real gem with counter help that speak english”
Reviews.Author: jazzpix
Reviews.Content: this hotel is an easy trip from airport on one bus. The room and the public areas were great. Very clean and quiet. All the people at the desk were very helpful and went out of their way to help us find locations and restaurants. Breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “BREAKFASTS TO DIE FOR”
Reviews.Author: goldie65
Reviews.Content: More than we had expected at a very reasonable price. Service excellent, rooms of a good size and standard. Everything very clean. Breakfast at 11 euros per day was excellent everything you could wish for. OK its a little off the main area but that is reflected in the price. We have paid up to 3 times for a hotel in Ramblas and Gothic areas which were inferior. Metro and buses just outside hotel and taxis only 5 euros into central area. We are in our sixties and walked several times into central town. If I want to be picky, it was a little noisy but after some good wine and a few cognacs sleep was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “disapointing”
Reviews.Author: teddycody
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK , it was pretty clean and communal areas pleasant, We were disapointed that we couldn't get a hot drink after 10.30 even though the "bar" area was next to reception desk, had to get a take-away from bar across street and return cups in morning ! not what you'd expect in a hotel of this size.parking was a horrible experience even in a small car!! a very tight squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmm50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money and definitely worth its three stars. Nice room, very clean, friendly and helpful staff. We had no problems with the air conditioning and even when we'd been out all day the room wasn't too hot anyway (temperatures outside were high 20s - low 30s). Location is also excellent - not bang in the centre but you could walk to Las Ramblas in about 15 minutes and the tube station is literally across the road so you can get to most major attractions in minutes. Considering what we paid I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived and would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Pertti-Keinonen
Reviews.Content: Silken Concordia perhaps isn’t a luxury accommodation, but definitely worth the three stars and absolutely great value for money. We stayed there for one week in July 2007 (24.-31.7.) with my better half and I have to say that we both loved it. Because there seems to have been some nags about the air conditioning I start by mentioning that it worked like a charm in our room. If anything, it felt almost too effective at times. And the temperature outside was in the 30-degrees-centigrade region the whole week. The service was delightful. We arrived there at 11am and they gave us our room straight away (we hadn’t requested an early check-in in advance). During the week the staff was very helpful with all our requests and questions. They also communicated quite fluently in English, so there was no language barrier either. Location was also near perfect (for us anyway): Walking distance from Plaza Catalunya, Rambla, Old town, Montjuïc, Font Magica, Port Vell etc. And a subway station right across the road to get you to those attractions further away. The neighborhood isn’t exactly something you’d call picturesque. I liked staying there though, because wandering in the streets nearby revealed a little bit of the unpolished, “true” Barcelona that you won’t find in the tourist-heavy areas. Although a tad rough round the edges, it wasn’t by any means an intimidating area to walk around even in the dark. And the hotel itself was newish, well-groomed and clean. We didn’t have the breakfast included in our room (luckily, I may add) but gave it one shot. It was in my opinion quite unimaginative and not worth the 12€/person/day. Ok, it got you full, but for that amount of money you will find much better eateries round the town. This review got a bit long and may sound like an advertisement, but we really didn’t find anything negative worth mentioning about the hotel. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Louisa32
Reviews.Content: Room was good & cleaned everyday to a good standard. The window wouldn't close properly & it was a very noisey area. The price was good. The view was awful as you can see from the photo. Wasn't very central so had to keep taking a bus or underground.

Reviews.Title: “May 07 visit”
Reviews.Author: Clairelj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 07. Great location and friendly staff. The room was nice, not too much noise considering you're in a city, temperature was ok and the aircon worked fine in our room. The size of the room was ok, about the same as a travel lodge room. We didnt have breakfast included in our stay but found plenty of places to eat around Gracia station. We used the tube loads (which is directly opp the hotel) and would recommend the 10 trips card which is approx 6 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth like ... silken!”
Reviews.Author: Bicas
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read didn't prepare me for this hotel. All my requests at the time of the reservations were satisfied: non-smokers, double bed... The room is big, the bed huge ( 3 persons could sleep there nicely), the small attentions in the bathroom - replaced every day - were fantastic: champoo, shower gel, comb, dental kit, shaving kit, tissues, nail kit, etc, etc. The room style was very modern, even the glasses for the minibar were stylish. The only minor problem were morning sounds, the maids cleaning (vacuming) the other rooms. The location is wonderful, very central, near all you want to visit in Barcelona. The staff, in general, is helpfull, but not so friendly (maybe a city behavior). The only exception was a very unfriendly breafast staff member. So unpleasant, to everyone. Maybe she's misplaced in such a nice place, with excelent accomodations, location, price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: citytravellersedgley
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel centrally located. just wish we had been advised better on train/metro. When coming out of airport you can catch the train to Catalunya (4 stops) then transfer to the metro line and travel to poble sac which takes you right outside the hotel. very easy to travel this way. bit like london underground but cleaner and easier to follow. should take you 20 minutes from airport to silken concordia. staff very helpful and breakfast good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paddy_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the Barcelona Festival at the end of September 06 and found it to be great value for money. It is clean, modern, and right across the road from Poble Sec tube station. Contrary to other reviews I found the staff very helpful, I booked directly with the hotel and forgot to request a smoking room and when we arrived there was none available, however, the receptionist did manage to get us one and we changed on the 3rd night which I thought was good service. The second room was on the turn of the corridor and was therefore quite a bit smaller than the first room but it was still adequate. Don`t remember having a problem with the room temp even though it was still quite hot outside when we were there. I think this is a good choice for the money. Restaurants up the street (turn left out of hotel) very good value and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Polite Staff/Clean room”
Reviews.Author: LouisaLondon
Reviews.Content: Staff were really poilite & helpful. Clean & comfortable rooms. Food in restaurant was delicious. Down points were the views from Hotel room - it was something like the third world. Also very noisey with people arguing around 2am from the opposite apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Just too Hot!”
Reviews.Author: themancalled_Dan
Reviews.Content: This could have been a really good stay but some major problems spoilt it as it was supposed to be a romantic anniversary get away. I will start with the negatives but there were some positives! We booked in fine but the staff were not particularly helpful. No explanation of the facitlites, we werenot told when breakfast was, what was available and when asked about surrounding facilities it always seemed like it such an effort to help us. We had booked a double room but when we got up to our room on the 6th floor, it was a Twin, 2 singles pushed tohether with seperate covers. Not great for a romantic getaway. However, we asked for it to be changed, which they did but only after they stated " We were not told you had booked a double!" Not our fault. It was clearly stated on our recepit (booked through priceline via tripadvisor) So we got into our room. Big enough, clean, modern design. The usual cable TV, marble effect bathroom etc. View from the window was of a big block of flats but the main problem was that the room was absolutley roasting so we tried the Air Con. This didnt work and only blew out even hotter air. So we opened the window but there was no draft and the tempareture didnt change. We went downstairs to notify reception but was simply told to turn the air off and just open the window and if that doesnt work "There is nothing else you can do" we were told. Not impressed at all. Even a fan would have done to get some air circulating. This made it quite uncomfortable sleeping, luckily we didn’t really spend a lot of time in the hotel. There was no relaxing bar area. All the restaraunt/Bar is all in an open plan reception but I’m not one for spending time in the hotel bar. Anyway, Not to be too negative but there were some positives! Breakfast was good, Eggs, sausage, bacon, cold meats, cheeses, fruit, juices and loads of pastries/ donuts etc. It is located opposite the Poble Sec metro or 20 mins walk to la rambla. Metro was so easy and 2 stops from La Ramblas and is easy access for the Airport railway line and all other metro lines. We walked first few times but with all the walking during the day we ended getting the metro for most attractions. OVERALL: It was okay but I would not go back again. Maybe we were unlucky in our room but the fact that the staff didn’t care about our comfort was infuiating. TIPS: To eat try: Taller de Tapas. Excellent chain of tapas restaraunts, really friendly, cheap and excellent food. The Chick Peas with seaweed and smoked ham was a surprising delight. Les Quinze Nits (The 15 Knights) just of the La Ramblas in Placa Reial. This place was great. Cheap, amazing food, varied menu. Cost us about 40 euros for a 3 course meal and a bottle of wine! However you will probably have to queue. We queued for 40 minutes to get in but it was worth it and the fact that people (tourists and locals) were queueing is a good sign in itself! If you need to watch sport (e.g. The Six Nations Rugby) then head to McCarthys Irish Bar. Its located a bit further up from the point where Via Laietana meets the Placa D'Antonio Maura (near the cathedral). It will cost 2.50 euros for a bottle of estrella instead of the 5.50 euros from any sports bars on the La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AGSicilyBound
Reviews.Content: Anyone staying at this hotel for any length of time will be more than satisfied with the standard of the rooms,quality of service from the staff and it's location easy access to all the sites of Barcelona. I will definately, seriously consider returning to this hotel for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but not as nice as the photos”
Reviews.Author: salchipapa
Reviews.Content: After shopping around for hotels, i think we found a real bargain with this hotel. it was modern, rigth across the street from the poble sec metro stop, and a quick walk to the central tourist area. while not effusively nice (like the rest of barcelonians we met), the staff were helpful and professional. our main observation was that the hotel was nice but could have been maintained a little better. the hotel is only a few years old, but already you could see that wear and tear on the furnishings. it is still has a nice design sense--modern with clean lines--but it's begining to be rough around the edges (our toilet wasn't propely sealed to the floor, the floor wasn't well vaccuumed, the two champagne flutes didn't match and the accompanying glass plate was broken, etc.). the rooms can be terribly hot in the winter as there is no fan and only an open window will allow you any sort of cool air, since the main heating presumably dominates the rooms even if you turn off your room's heating. overall, it was a nice hotel and we enjoyed out stay. we found an excellent deal online and this hotel was the best in our price range! **watch out for the tapas bars across the street. we encountered extremely rude service and were bellowed at by the server.

HotelInfo.Name: Silken Concordia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Avinguda del Parallel, 115, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
